intro: Silene odontopetala subsp. physocalyx, commonly known as the narrow-leaved campion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, known for its showy flowers and succulent leaves. Silene odontopetala subsp. physocalyx is typically found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas.
